noun.description: The state or process of a species, family, or larger group being or becoming extinct.
examples: the extinction of the great auk

noun.description: Reduction in the intensity of light or other radiation as it passes through a medium or object, due to absorption, reflection, and scattering.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin exstinctio(n-), from exstinguere quench (see extinguish).
